item.title: Yakuza Kiwami 3 & Dark Ties details stories, battle styles, and ability upgrades
item.content:encoded:
Get the details below.

‚ñ† Yakuza 3 Kiwami

‚óè Story: When the Peace is Shattered, the Dragon of Dojima Makes His Return

After the conflict with the Omi Alliance, Kazuma Kiryu entrusts the future of the Tojo Clan to Daigo Dojima and relocates to Okinawa with Haruka.

There, he runs Morning Glory, an orphanage connected to his foster father Shintaro Kazama, and spends his day in peace with his children‚Ä¶ until that peace is disturbed by the looming threat of a government-backed resort development plan.

The orphanage is shaken by a struggle over vested interests, the Tojo Clan is embroiled in a fierce succession dispute, and a massive conspiracy with its roots deep in the political world begins to unravel. As all these forces converge, Kazuma Kiryu must face new conflicts in Okinawa and Tokyo head-on.

‚óè Characters

Goro Majima (portrayed by Hidenari Ugaki)
Tojo Clan Lieutenant and Majima Family Patriarch

‚ÄúWith me, it‚Äôs hit hard or hit the bricks! And ain‚Äôt nobody tellin‚Äô me what to do if they can‚Äôt bring the heat.‚Äù

Dubbed the Mad Dog of Shimano, his wild and unpredictable behavior strikes fear into friend and foe alike.

Majima‚Äôs obsession with Kiryu drives him to seek him out for brawls. Though he left the Tojo Clan to start his own construction company, Majima returns to the clan at Kiryu‚Äôs behest.

Yoshinobu Suzuki (portrayed by Michitaka Kobayashi)
Land, Infrastructure, and Transport Minister

‚ÄúThen you must know I strive to better Okinawa‚Äôs standard of living. It is a responsibility I hold in the highest regard.‚Äù

Hoping to increase tourism to Okinawa, Suzuki endorses the luxury resort plan and opposes Minister of Defense Tamiya‚Äôs military expansion bill.

The Man in Black (portrayed by Charles Glover)

‚ÄúThis is the end of the line for you, Kazuma Kiryu!‚Äù

A man clad in a black coat who ambushes Kiryu. Everything about him is a complete enigma.

The Stranger (portrayed by Tetesuya Watari)

‚ÄúI‚Äôll see you again‚Ä¶ in hell.‚Äù

A man who shot Daigo Dojima during a visit to Tojo Clan HQ. Bears great resemblance to the late Shintaro Kazama, Kiryu‚Äôs adopted father.

Both his objectives and identity remain a mystery.

‚óè Battle

Dragon of Dojima: Kiwami Style

The ultimate evolution of the classic Dragon of Dojima style, featuring the most attack techniques in the series‚Äô history. A bold, overwhelming brawler style that embodies the essence of Kazuma Kiryu‚Äôs iconic combat.

As always, Kiryu can pick up objects on the ground and transform them into powerful weapons!

‚ÄîHeat Actions

The Dragon of Dojima: Kiwami Style gives Kiryu access to an arsenal of Heat Actions that make use of his bare-knuckle skills and the surrounding environment.

In addition to fan favorites from the original Yakuza 3, a host of brand-new Heat Abilities will also be at your disposal!

‚ÄîDragon Boost

Kiryu can power up by maxing out his gauge and activating his Dragon Boost. While in this state, he can dish out explosive finishers, including violent piledrivers and superhuman throws.

Use Kiryu‚Äôs Dragon Finisher to deliver a devastating final attack.

Ryukyu Style

A battle style rooted in Okinawan martial arts. Its base stance utilizes a tinbe and rochin, a traditional shield and short spear. Simply mash or hold down the buttons to weave in flashy sai, nichogama, tonfa, tekko, nunchaku, eiku, and surujin attacks.

Shield yourself from incoming bullets with the tinbe and turn the tide of battle!

‚ÄîHeat Actions

The Ryukyu style also has access to highly technical Heat Actions incorporating Okinawan weaponry.

Certain Heat Actions can be seamlessly woven in after a standard combo. Throw a barrage of attacks and follow up with one of these techniques to decimate your foes!

‚ÄîDragon Boost

Kiryu can power up by maxing out his gauge and activating his Dragon Boost.

Activate this state while using Ryukyu Style to unlock the full potential of Kiryu‚Äôs weaponry. Launch sai as projectiles, hook enemies with nichogama, and send out an overwhelming Dragon Finisher!

Upgrading Abilities: Hone Yourself Through Training

Kiryu‚Äôs ability upgrades give him access to his most diverse skill set to date. Complete missions and undergo training to mold Kiryu as you see fit.

Yakuza Kiwami 3 also offers a new way to strengthen Kiryu. Customize his cell phone with straps and other accessories to boost his motivation, taking his abilities to new heights.

‚ÄîSkill Tree

‚ÄîCell Phone Customization

‚ñ† Dark Ties

‚óè Story: A Man Drawn into the Heart of the Underworld

The year is 2007. Yoshitaka Mine had once launched a successful startup, only to be stabbed in the back by a trusted partner.
Wandering Kaumorocho in a drunken stupor, he witnesses a gruesome conflict between yakuza factions. After watching a subordinate of Daigo Dojima sacrifice themselves, Mine longs to discover what makes a bond transcend material gain.

He approaches Tsuyoshi Kanda of the Tojo Clan‚Äôs Nishikiyama Family in hopes of learning more about Daigo. Kanda welcomes him in as his sworn brother and right-hand man. Working in tandem, they bring significant wealth into the family‚Äôs coffers.
Soon, the Tojo Clan catches wind of Mine and Kanda‚Äôs actions and springs into action. As Mine and Kanda navigate their way through this crisis, Mine begins to feel a sense of kinship toward Kanda.

As Mine ponders whether this is the unshakeable bond he‚Äôd been searching for, he receives a sudden invitation from Daigo Dojima.

‚óè Battle

Battle Style: Stylish Shoot-Boxing Combat

Mine uses an elegant fighting style based on shoot-boxing. Exploit openings in your opponent‚Äôs defense to deliver refined combos and beat down enemies. Dash freely through the air to overwhelm foes with unpredictable movement.

Many of the techniques used by Mine in the original Yakuza 3 are also available. Unleash your inner villain and show no mercy!

‚ÄîDark Awakening

Mine builds up his Shackled Heart by attacking enemies and can spend it to trigger Dark Awakening, a mode that empowers Mine.

Using Dark Awakening, Mine drops his facade, revealing his true ferocity and transforming his battle animations and techniques. Go berserk, drag your opponent‚Äôs faces along the ground, and brutalize them with a storm of relentless strikes.

Let your dark side loose and go wild in battle!

‚ÄîHeat Actions

Mine possesses many stylish, cold-blooded Heat Actions, including an all-out barrage to the face and a brutal gut punch. During Dark Awakening, his Heat Actions evolve. Channel Mine‚Äôs inner darkness and obliterate his enemies!

Upgrading Abilities: Unlocking Mine‚Äôs Callous Ferocity

Mine‚Äôs upgrades refine his combat abilities, improving his techniques and unlocking mid-air Heat Actions.

A number of upgrades to Dark Awakening are also available! Embolden Mine‚Äôs composure and ferocity and make quick work of your enemies!

‚ÄîSkill Tree



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/yakuza-kiwami-3-dark-ties-details-stories-battle-styles-and-ability-upgrades

item.title: Former Wizards of the Coast exec resurrects canceled game at new studio
item.content:encoded:
Image and logo via Level Headed Games.

A game previously canceled by Dungeons & Dragons and Magic: The Gathering owner Wizards of the Coast has found new life at a new studio helmed by a former executive.

Today, Level Headed Games founder Leah Hoyer‚Äîformerly the GM and vice president of creative at Wizards of the Coast‚Äîannounced that her studio has secured ownership of the hereto unannounced "collaborative arena party game." Hoyer had led development on the game while at Wizards, but left the company (per her LinkedIn page) in February 2023, after Bloomberg News reported the company canceled five in-development games.

Hoyer founded Level Headed Games that same month with "participation" in an a16z Speedrun. It appears the game is not based on an existing property. The company described the game as an "accessible gaming experience" aimed at "Gen Z and multi-generational" players, and said the game was previously in development at Wizards' "new IP studio."

Hoyer said early testing showed the game had "excellent promise," and the team had been making "rapid progress" in building the new setting.

‚ÄúWe are grateful to Wizards of the Coast that we were able to keep the project going," she concluded. "We aren‚Äôt building our game the way we originally thought we would, but change is the one constant in the industry these days. We regrouped, made critical shifts to reflect the realities of our new team size, and got back to work making something that we are really proud of."

Related:NetEase subsidiary Bad Brain Game Studios is shutting down

About the Author

Senior Editor, GameDeveloper.com

Bryant Francis is a writer, journalist, and narrative designer based in Boston, MA. He currently writes for Game Developer, a leading B2B publication for the video game industry. His credits include Proxy Studios' upcoming 4X strategy game Zephon and Amplitude Studio's 2017 game Endless Space 2.

item.title: Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A Mega Dimension DLC Launches Next Month With Pok√©mon Over Level 100 And More
item.content:encoded:
Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A launched last month on October 16, with the promise of the previously announced Mega Dimension DLC on the way. In a new trailer released today, developer Game Freak has revealed Mega Dimension will launch on December 10, and it will feature a new Hyperspace Lumiose to explore, Pok√©mon exceeding Level 100, and more. 

In the Mega Dimension DLC, trainers will revisit Lumiose as spatial distortions begin to form around the city, according to a press release from Nintendo. "Donut chef Ansha and her companion, the Mythical Pok√©mon Hoopa, will guide players as they explore the mysterious dimension known as Hyperspace Lumiose," the press release continues. "This not-quite Lumiose City is home to newly discovered Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon and other Pok√©mon not usually found in Lumiose, some of which can exceed the normal limit of Level 100 with hyperspace levels." 

Nintendo says Hoopa's powers are awakened after it receives one of Ansha's donuts (must be an amazing donut), transforming the distortions around Lumiose into portals to Hyperspace Lumiose. Those portals are how trainers will reach this new area, and once there, Ansha can use berries to create new kinds of donuts that grant unique effects in Hyperspace. She can even use Hyperspace Berries needed for taking on the high-level Pok√©mon of Hyperspace. 

"Trainers will be joined by new allies such as Korrina, a successor to a line of Mega Evolution gurus determined to encounter every Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon," according to the press release. "Together with Team MZ, players will explore Hyperspace Lumiose, uncover its secrets, and tackle the strange events befalling Lumiose City." 

With Mega Dimension comes a slew of additional Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon to catch, including Mega Chimecho and Mega Baxcalibur. 

Alongside today's announcement, Nintendo says starting today, players can claim a Diancite Stone through the Mystery Gift feature in the base Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A game, which unlocks an opportunity to catch Diancie in an extra side mission called "Shine Bright like a Gemstone." Once you've claimed your Diancite via Mystery Gift, visit the Looker Bureau, where Mimi the Espurr ‚Äì Emma's partner Pok√©mon ‚Äì will take a special interest in the Mega Stone, setting "Shine Bright like a Gemstone" in motion. 

If you have already purchased the Mega Dimension DLC, you have the following outfits available in-game already: 

And if you pre-order the DLC, you'll receive the following bonus Pok√© Balls: 

Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A ‚Äì Mega Dimension DLC launches next month on December 10 on Nintendo Switch 2 and Switch. 

In the meantime, read Game Informer's Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A review, and then read this opinion piece about how Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A's worst side mission disrespects nearly three decades of history. After that, read about how Pok√©mon Legends: Z-A sold nearly 6 million copies in its first week. 

Are you hopping into Mega Dimension next month? Let us know in the comments below!

item.title: After chasing NFTs and the metaverse, Square Enix wants generative AI to do 70% of its QA by 2027
item.content:encoded:
Square Enix wants 70% of its QA work to be handled by generative AI by the end of 2027, in partnership with the University of Tokyo's Matsuo-Iwasawa Laboratory.

Announced in a progress report for last year's Mid-Term Business Plan, the company notes its reason for doing so, the hope that: "through the use of automation technology, aim to improve the efficiency of QA operations and establish a competitive advantage in game development."

This collaboration between Square Enix and the Matsuo-Iwasawa Laboratory comes in the form of a research team with more than ten members, filled with both researchers from the Matsuo-Iwasawa Laboratory, as well as engineers from Square Enix.

The Matsuo-Iwasawa Laboratory is a dedicated department of the University of Tokyo which focuses on new technology. It states on its official website a desire to "create an ecosystem that is equivalent to Silicon Valley".

Square Enix has stated that within a year since the initiation of its Mid-Term Business Plan, the company has been "promoting AI utilization in Japan", as part of its goal to "Roll out initiatives to create additional foundational stability".

Back in February, Square Enix already announced it was using AI during game development, specifically Azure Open AI. Its CEO stated at the start of 2024 that the company would be "aggressive in applying AI".

The company has also expressed interest in Metaverse and blockchain games. The president of Square Enix Yosuke Matsuda wrote in 2022 that the Metaverse would play a role in the company's future. Square Enix also launched a blockchain game Symbogenesis in 2023, which entered its final season eight months ago.

Only early this week, Square Enix and other Japanese publishers asked Open AI to cease training it's Sora 2 model on their creative works. As for as the fruits of Square Enix's AI-assisted labour, the publisher "dabbled" with the technology when making Foamstars. Updates for Foamstars ceased at the start of this year.

Related topics

item.title: Permafrost early access is going to come in 2026
item.content:encoded:
Permafrost will be coming to Steam Early Access in 2026, SpaceRocket Games has announced today, but a playtest will be taking place ahead of the early access release. You can register for the Permafrost playtest now via the game‚Äôs Steam page. Along with the early access announcement, a new trailer for Permafrost has been released showing various elements of gameplay including base building, hunting, and co-operative play.

In a blog post, the development team said, ‚ÄúFirst of all, thank you for your support and patience throughout the last year. Your dedication to providing critical feedback, suggestions, bug reports and technical troubleshooting during our demo was a literal game changer. With your help, we have been able to lock in the vision for our Early Access release ‚Äì we have been in the icy trenches since ‚Äì focusing on improving the core elements of the game, including stability, performance, and key gameplay foundations. So, this brings us to the release date. Permafrost will release into Early Access in 2026. We want to bring the best possible Early Access release build to you ‚Äì one that‚Äôs not rushed, but rather polished and with a solid foundation, built with your feedback, reports, and requests. In other words, it‚Äôs for the best. We know it sucks to wait, but hang in there and let the devs cook, it will be worth it.‚Äù

Permafrost takes place in a world where the moon shattered and Earth plunged into a never-ending ice age. Among this icy world, players will need to find scarce resources, hunt for food, and work with each other to survive the wintry landscape. The game supports four player co-op but there may be clashes with groups that are not your own. The cold will be an ever present danger to all players, so building shelters will be necessary to survive. The development team will be releasing a deep dive on Permafrost next week to delve more into the game‚Äôs systems.

Source: Steam



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/06/permafrost-early-access-is-going-to-come-in-2026/

We can expect new Mega Evolutions (Mega Raichu X and Mega Raichu Y take pride of place on the key art), plenty of Hoopa content, and more than a little eerily-silent dialogue from you and your MZ pals. Hey, at least the dimension-hopping looks interesting enough.

item.title: Service! Overcooked 2 - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition Is Ready To Eat Today
item.content:encoded:
I need hands!

Well here's a dish that we weren't expecting! Team17 and Ghost Town Games have announced that Overcooked 2! - Nintendo Switch 2 Edition is being served up today!

As initially revealed back in the September Direct, this is the same old co-op cooking chaos that we all know and love, garnished with some new features to make the most of the beefed-up system.

We've got 4k 60fps gameplay in docked mode, we've got camera integration so everyone's screaming faces can appear on screen, we've got GameShare for playing with pals on one copy of the game, heck, there's even a new chef: The Pristine Platinum Platypus.

A pretty balanced meal, no? Well, it won't arrive for free. Those with the Switch 1 version of the game will be able to upgrade for ¬£7.99 / ‚Ç¨9.99 / $9.99, or you can pick up the full Switch 2 Edition for ¬£24.99 / ‚Ç¨29.99 / $29.99 on the eShop. There is a 20% discount running on the storefront for one week only, so you can sneak in and grab an early bird offer if you want to plate up soon.

And for all those wondering, yes, there is cross-progression for this release, so all of your precious DLC and save data can be transferred over to the new edition without any troubles ‚Äî nobody wants to see those three-star runs go to waste.

A spot of Overcooked can be a dangerous game over the holiday season, but with the right chefs in the kitchen, we're ready to head back in for another good old giggle.

Will you be checking out this Nintendo Switch 2 Edition? Watch the corners, and let us know in the comments.

Jim came to Nintendo Life in 2022 and, despite his insistence that The Minish Cap is the best Zelda game and his unwavering love for the Star Wars prequels (yes, really), he has continued to write news and features on the site ever since.
